titlepage.p: © 2010 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The papers contain materials relating to American military activities during the Vietnam War, including a memoir, propaganda leaflets, other printed matter, and photographs. Also includes photographs of postwar Vietnam; and photographs, postcards, guidebooks, and other printed matter relating to war monuments and other historical monuments and museums in various countries of Asia and Europe.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Peter Oslin Hefron papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2010.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Hefron was a private first class in the United States Army, serving as a member of the 90th Replacement Battalion from 1969 to 1970, and professor of political science at Troy State University, Pacific Region, and European Region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers contain materials relating to American military activities during the Vietnam War, including a memoir, propaganda leaflets, other printed matter, and photographs. They include photographs of postwar Vietnam; and photographs, postcards, guidebooks, and other printed matter relating to war monuments and other historical monuments and museums in various countries of Asia and Europe.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Vietnam War, 1961-1975.
Vietnam War, 1961-1975--Propaganda.
War memorials.

scopecontent.p: Includes memoir, psychological warfare leaflets, collected materials, and photographs. Arranged by format.

did.unittitle: "Memories of a U.S. Army Replacement Battalion: Service and Disservice to the Vietnam War Effort," by Peter O. Hefron, Ph.D. Unpublished typescript,

"American GIs"; "Officers and Men in the US Armed Forces in South VN!" (2)
"Early End to the Vietnam War, American Troops Back Home Now"; "U.S. Servicemen!" (2)

"The 10 point over-all solution of the SVNNLF to the South Vietnam problem helps restore peace in V.N."; "American G.I's" (2)
